required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of ASC42 Combined With ETV and PEG-IFN α-2a in Subjects With HBV
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Multi-center, Randomized, Single-blind, Placebo-controlled to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of ASC42 Tablets in Combination With Entecavir and Pegylated Interferon α-2a in Subjects With Chronic Hepatitis B Virus

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase2, randomized, single-blind, placebo controlled and multi-center study in adults with chronic hepatitis B virus. The study is aimed at evaluating efficacy and safety of ASC42 in combination with entecavir and pegylated interferon α-2a in subjects with chronic hepatitis B virus.

primary_outcome.measure: Serum HBsAg change compared with baseline
Serum HBV pgRNA change compared with baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum HBsAg change compared with baseline
Serum HBV pgRNA change compared with baseline

arm_group.description: ASC42 10mg, ih PEG-IFN α-2a and ETV for 12 weeks.
ASC42 15mg , ih PEG-IFN α-2a and ETV for 12 weeks.
Placebo, ih PEG-IFN α-2a and ETV for 12 weeks.

intervention.description: ih PEG-IFN α-2a 180μg subcutaneous injection once a week.
